snippet: The Nov. 22 issue has a secondary cover on the back page that carries the Rolling Stone nameplate but has cover lines entirely in Spanish.
abstract: Advertising column notes that Nov 22 issue of Rolling Stone magazine will feature a second cover on the back page entirely in Spanish; special section also features Spanish ads and content to appeal to a growing demographic in the United States.

headline.main: Rolling Stone Pages Aimed at Latinos, Even the Ads
headline.print_headline: Rolling Stone Pages Aimed at Latinos, Even the Ads

snippet: You can transfer photos directly from a camera to an iPad, as long as you have the right adapter.
abstract: You can transfer photos directly from a camera to an iPad, as long as you have the right adapter.

snippet: The winner of the presidential election will claim the White House, but the loser could find a lucrative job in high finance by providing advice on deals or arranging speaking engagements.
abstract: The winner of the presidential election will claim the White House, but the loser could find a lucrative job in high finance by providing advice on deals or arranging speaking engagements.

headline.main: Wall Street Offers a Second Career for Former Politicians
headline.print_headline: On Wall Street, a Lucrative Second Career Awaits Former Politicians

snippet: Rochdale Securities, which is known for employing the banking analyst Dick Bove, is in negotiations to sell itself or receive a cash infusion from outside investors.
abstract: Rochdale Securities, which is known for employing the banking analyst Dick Bove, is in negotiations to sell itself or receive a cash infusion from outside investors.

headline.main: Big Bet Sours, Imperiling Small Firm

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and PETER LATTMAN

snippet: Tech and media companies like Apple, Facebook, Google, Viacom and Disney are pushing back against a proposal by federal regulators to strengthen online privacy protections for children.
abstract: Tech and media companies like Apple, Facebook, Google, Viacom and Disney are pushing back against a proposal by federal regulators to strengthen online privacy protections for children.

headline.main: Daily Report: Tech and Media Companies Resist Proposal to Strengthen Online Privacy Protections for Children

snippet: Mikhail D. Prokhorov, the Nets owner spoke with Herb Turetzky, the Nets scorekeeper and perhaps the man who best understands the franchise's past.
abstract: Mikhail D. Prokhorov, the Nets owner spoke with Herb Turetzky, the Nets scorekeeper and perhaps the man who best understands the franchise's past.

headline.main: In Brooklyn, an Eye on the Past and Excitement for the Future

snippet: A federal judge on Madison, Wis., threw out Apple’s suit that licensing practices by Google’s Motorola unit were unfair, saying she was unsure she had the authority to hear the claim.
abstract: Federal Judge Barbara B Crabb in Madison, Wis, throws out Apple's lawsuit against Google's Motorola unit that claimed patent abuse, saying she is unsure she has authority to hear claim; action is setback for iPhone maker in its efforts to gain leverage in smartphone patent wars.

snippet: Richard Nelson’s “Sorry” is a real-time drama set on Election Day 2012.
abstract: Richard Nelson's drama Sorry, which opens at Public Theater on Election Day, features tweaked dialogue that reflects up-to-the-minute changes in America's political landscape.

headline.main: The Nation, Refracted in a Family
headline.print_headline: The Nation, Refracted In a Family

snippet: The effort to reopen schools shut by Hurricane Sandy presented officials with a tangled puzzle and New York City’s 1.1 million students with a drastically altered landscape.
abstract: New York City struggles with logistical and transit snarls in effort to reopen schools shut by Hurricane Sandy; officials scramble to deal with displacements, delayed openings, modified schedules and new plans for evacuees using school buildings in attempt to return students to classrooms as soon as possible.

headline.main: Schools Reopen to Snarls; Transit Headaches Persist
headline.print_headline: Schools Reopen to Snarls; Transit Headaches Persist

snippet: Given the close presidential race, equities moved marginally higher and lower in quiet, uncommitted dealings.
abstract: Stocks post slight gains in light trading ahead of presidential election.

headline.main: As Decision Day Looms, Trading Seems Indecisive
headline.print_headline: As Decision Day Looms, Trading Seems Indecisive
